page.title: 03MINING, PARK MILL 2.
page.content: EMLEY SOKE MILL IS RECALLED BY THE NAME "PARK MILL COLLIERY".(257118) {AN ACCOUNT OF MINING AT PARK MILL {COLLIERY BY BRIAN WHARAM}. I AM A COALMINER WORKING AT PARK MILL COLLIERY, CLAYTON WEST. THIS IS AN OLD COAL MINE FIRST OPENED OVER A{100 {YEARS}AGO. IN THOSE DAYS MINERS USED CANDLES FOR LIGHT AND HAD TO DIG THE COAL OUT USING {PICKS}AND { {SHOVELS.}IT WAS VERY HARD WORK. EVEN 10 YEAR OLD BOYS AND GIRLS WORKED DOWN THE MINE. THEY HAD TO GO HOME DIRTY AS THERE WERE NO BATHS AT THE PIT. SOME MINERS NEVER USED TO WASH THEIR BACKS AS THEY THOUGHT THIS WOULD MAKE THEM WEAK AND WOULD BE UNABLE TO DIG COAL. {CONDITIONS}ARE MUCH BETTER TODAY. WE HAVE ELECTRIC LIGHTS IN THE MAIN TUNNELS AND A 'CAP LAMP' WHICH FIXES ON TO OUR SAFETY HELMETS.
